moves.2. Nf3: developing a knight and attacking the pawn
moves.2... f6: f6??  black falls into a trap
moves.3. Nxe5: seems like a bad move right?  let's see.
moves.4... g6: another response would be Ke7, but your king would be in the middle of the board
moves.6. Qxh8 Qg7: Qg7??  why not Qxe4 .  Then when Be2 blocks, Qxg2 threatening the take the rook

moves.10. Bb5: pins knight and hopes to double up black's pawns

moves.18. Nxe4: i happily take the free piece

moves.20... Ke7 21. Nxe8 Kxe8 22. b3: stops knight c4, but anyway, the rest of the game is smooth sailing.
